backbone

Class Controls

  • java.lang.Object
    • backbone.Controls
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Controls
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    Class which delegates itself with both the key and mouse controls for the user and also all movement throughout the environment including the player

      • move

        public com.ardor3d.math.Vector3[] move(com.ardor3d.math.type.ReadOnlyVector3 startingPos,
                              com.ardor3d.math.type.ReadOnlyVector3 startingDir,
                              com.ardor3d.math.type.ReadOnlyVector3 orig,
                              boolean portaled)
        Moves an object represented by a position, direction its facing, and move vector
        Parameters:
        startingPos - the starting position
        startingDir - the starting facing direction
        orig - the move vector
        portaled - a boolean delegating whether it should move through portals
        Returns:
        the vector3[] data in form new position, new direction, new move

      • move

        public com.ardor3d.math.Vector3 move(com.ardor3d.renderer.Camera camera,
                            com.ardor3d.math.Vector3 orig,
                            boolean portaled)
        Moves the camera throughout the environment
        Parameters:
        camera - the camera
        orig - the vector to move the camera
        portaled - a boolean delegating whether or not you should move through a portal
        Returns:
        the vector3 the modified vector to move (0 if hits wall, refleted if bounced, etc)

      • move

        public void move(com.ardor3d.renderer.Camera camera,
        double tpf)
        Moves the camera based on key/mouse input
        Parameters:
        camera - the camera
        tpf - the time between updates
